decks.notes: The main strategy of this deck is to quickly build up board presence and apply pressure on the opponent with cheap and efficient spells and creatures. The focus is on dealing damage as quickly as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck includes a mix of burn spells, efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, and cantrips to dig through the deck for more threats. Mishra's Bauble also provides card advantage and helps to trigger prowess abilities on creatures. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to the deck's key colors.

This deck focuses on quickly generating artifacts to power up various effects and abilities, utilizing cards such as Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help to recur artifacts and draw cards, while Kappa Cannoneer and Thought Monitor provide additional threats and removal options. The deck also includes a mix of utility artifacts like Aether Spellbomb and Pithing Needle, as well as disruption with cards like Metallic Rebuke and lavaspur Boots. Urza's Saga serves as a powerful engine to search for key pieces and generate additional value in the late game.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to bring out powerful combo pieces like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. By utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor, the deck can quickly accelerate its mana production and search for key lands such as Urza's Saga. This allows the deck to assemble the Amulet Titan combo and overwhelm opponents with a sudden surge of powerful creatures and land triggers. The combination of ramp, land search, and combo potential makes this deck a formidable force in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. It also includes control elements like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to create a strong board presence while disrupting and controlling the opponent's strategy, ultimately overwhelming them with powerful Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a board presence with artifacts and creatures to overwhelm the opponent. Emry, Lurker of the Loch allows for recursion of key artifacts like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble, while cards like Thought Monitor and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage. Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for artifacts, and Metallic Rebuke offers disruption for the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board, generate value from artifacts, and close out the game with efficient threats.

The main concept of this Jeskai Control deck is to have a versatile range of removal and counterspells to control the game and disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck includes various instant-speed spells like Counterspell, Force of Negation, and Spell Snare to counter threats, along with cards like Wrath of the Skies and Galvanic Discharge for removal. Teferi, Time Raveler and LÃ³rien Revealed provide additional control elements, while cards like Consign to Memory and Expressive Iteration help dig for key pieces. The deck also has a selection of powerful threats like Nulldrifter and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to close out the game.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana with cards like Ruby Medallion, Desperate Ritual, and Manamorphose to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Stormscale Scion. By chaining together spells and utilizing Past in Flames to recast them from the graveyard, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with explosive combos. The inclusion of cards like Glimpse the Impossible and Grapeshot provide additional win conditions, while Wish allows for flexibility in finding key pieces. The deck also features some card draw and scrying effects to help maintain consistency and find necessary combo pieces.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Mutagenic Growth, while also gaining card advantage from cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration. The deck aims to control the board with creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, while also providing reach with burn spells. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using efficient removal spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to control the board with cards like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial while attacking with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu. The deck also includes Leyline cards to provide additional support and protection. By quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck aims to quickly flood the board with artifacts and use them to generate mana, protecting them with counterspells and removal spells while drawing cards to maintain card advantage. The key strategy revolves around utilizing Emry, Lurker of the Loch to recur artifacts from the graveyard, while also taking advantage of Urza's Saga to generate powerful tokens. By overwhelming the opponent with a mix of efficient threats and disruptive spells, the deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells. Key cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide early pressure, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory offer powerful late-game finishers. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and push through for the win. With an efficient mana base and a strong mix of threats and removal, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out games quickly.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays combined with disruptive abilities to disrupt the opponent's strategy and pressure them with efficient creatures and removal. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Ephemerate, along with Aether Vial to cheat out creatures, the deck aims to control the flow of the game and close out matches quickly. The creatures in the deck provide value through enter the battlefield effects and can be repeatedly recur with cards like Flickerwisp and Recruiter of the Guard. Overall, the deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building a strong board presence to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage through card draw and graveyard recursion. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, while maintaining a strong defensive position with efficient removal spells and card draw options. By carefully managing resources and controlling the pace of the game, the Dimir Control deck can outlast opponents and secure victory through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and disruption, while also ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures. The key strategy is to use cards like All Is Dust and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to clear the board and then deploy massive threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to quickly close out the game. The deck also includes cards like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the battlefield.

The deck focuses on using ramp spells and Eldrazi creatures to control the game. With powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly. Cards like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also providing additional value. The deck also includes cards like World Breaker and Sowing Mycospawn to deal with specific threats. By ramping into big threats early and controlling the board, the deck looks to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 setting in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on using Goryo's Vengeance to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand into play from the graveyard. Cards like Psychic Frog and Fallaji Archaeologist help fill the graveyard quickly, while cards like Solitude and Consign to Memory provide versatility in dealing with threats. Ephemerate and Force of Negation protect your combos, while Tainted Indulgence and Thoughtseize disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck aims to quickly set up a game-winning combo by reanimating key threats while controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy.
